intro: Mastacanthus barbula, commonly known as the hairy ant plant, is a unique member of the Araliaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its distinctive hairy foliage and its ability to produce a sticky substance that traps small insects. This adaptation helps it obtain nutrients in nutrient-poor soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological and horticultural study.
